intro: Linum crispum, commonly known as sweet William, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil. Linum crispum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in perfumery.
